title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Macomb, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at a company wide job fair and it was a very easy and pleasant experience. The questions asked were straightforward and the two managers I interviewed with were welcoming and friendly.
Interview Questions: One question was, what do you think going above and beyond as a nurse means?

title: Midlevel Provider Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward process with basic interview questions asked. Overall a good experience and nothing too out of ordinary in the questions. Kind and supportive staff members throughout the process as well
Interview Questions: What is what challenge you anticipate to encounter starting?

title: Surgical Scheduler Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Very personable every one was polite and very informative. I felt at ease and conformable. I enjoyed my interview and was told very important components of what the job consists of.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness and strengths?

title: CDM Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Troy, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Interview with team and manager- several questions about how to handle teamwork, stress, time management and behavioral questions. In person interview. Great interview experience with leadership and leads. Overall, good experience
Interview Questions: What is your greatest accomplishments

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Quick fast and easy process lovely team can’t wait to join she was the most amazing person ever thank you for the opportunity to join us and for the opportunity you are a true inspiration to me and I
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Bone Densitometry Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview. Be yourself and use your experiences to give a better picture of the type of person you are. Use scenarios when asked questions. Situational questions may be asked as well.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself? or what whould people say about you?

title: Nurse Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (West Bloomfield, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Business casual interview with job shadow after. Very basic interview questions and comfortable interview environment. The staff and site were clean and well organized. Interview went smooth and on time.
Interview Questions: How do you handle work conflict.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Staff of Nurses interviewed me collectively & asked a few questions each. They wanted to know what my goals were in Medicine in the long run. It was a good experience!
Interview Questions: what is your career goal?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview only, no in person interview, asked 20 questions,mostly about my background. I explained my back ground and my education work experience etc. Never received the text person interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, are you going to school

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy and comfortable. The managers did not give me a hard time and they listened to everything I had to say and hired me on spot.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a transporter.

title: Family Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Bloomfield Township, MI)
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and relaxed. Job at Maplegrove Treatment Center. Started as Admission Officer. I loved my job at HFHS Maplegrove. Don’t be late for interview. You will not get hired. Relaxed interview basically expanded on your previous experience and the things you wrote in your resume. Explained the job responsibility. After being an admissions offer Zi worked in community education. Great interview. Super great supervisor inquired about me through someone else. Gave me experience I’ve carried with me.
Interview Questions: She made a decision before the face to face interview to hire me. Very relaxed. Asked about attendance. Telling me about responsibilities. Conversation was back and forth between two supervisors and me. It has sense changed. Laid off a lot of people with pandemic and never hired them back.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Macomb, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at a company wide job fair and it was a very easy and pleasant experience. The questions asked were straightforward and the two managers I interviewed with were welcoming and friendly.
Interview Questions: One question was, what do you think going above and beyond as a nurse means?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, straight to the point and asked questions about experience. Easy questions. Answered all questions in regards to pay and benefits. Was straight forward with all questions and answers
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Wyandotte, MI) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Super easy and laid back interviewing process, over the phone interview then followed by an in person meet and greet. Offer was given during the interview, again the interview is straight forward.
Interview Questions: Asked about experience and schooling

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview, then had an in person interview with the main rehab manager and then two other therapists. The interview consisted of general questions about my experience and response to certain situations.
Interview Questions: When was a time you were put into a difficult situation and how did you overcome it?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions:
Employer reached out within a week of putting in my application
The interview was very straightforward, offered the position on the spot. Was able to start work within two weeks. Drug screen was required and a physical to begin working.
Interview Questions: What was a challenge that you overcame.

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Ferndale, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online then completed a brief phone screening. I later had a zoom interview. There were a lot of people in the interview. It felt excessive and unnecessary as only one person spoke. The person who did speak was very dismissive. They made a number of comments which suggested that they never read my resume. They also diminished my experience. Very negative experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Dialysis Biomedical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went well. Applied and within two weeks got an answer. One of the fastest interview process I have been through.  Super low ball offer like we are not in one of the hottest job markets in decades. Could of almost went to Amazon and Made more.
Interview Questions: Am I available for overtime

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions regarding your background and your previous work. They introduced me to their lab members and showed me what they are currently working on and their future aims. Staffs were friendly and accommodating.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Case Management Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really quick, informative, comfortable and professional. I felt confident during the interview and the interviewer was very welcoming. They went over benefits of the job, what a day would be like, and answered all of my questions.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakness?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was very quick she explain the job and duties I will be doing. Explained training and work schedule. Asked me 8 simple questions and asked if I had any question. She answered all of my question and offered me the position on the spot. She told me HR would be sending me a job offer not even 10 mins after I left I received and email with the job offer.
Interview Questions: Who motivates me everyday to come to work and go to nursing school?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Their applicant tracking system prevents any and all qualified candidates from being connected with positions in dire need of being filled. Actual professionals in  the field should be involved in this process, not an algorithm. This application process is perpetuating a staffing shortage and begs the question: What legitimate role is HR/recruiters playing in resolving the predicament facing the corporation? It's not.
Interview Questions: Boilerplate questions that have no bearing on the work to be performed.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Emergency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The recruiting and interview process was so easy! The managers were all extremely welcoming and friendly!!  The interview itself was pretty challenging as the manager asked lots of scenario based critical thinking questions , but she guided me through them and it was a good learning experience !!
Interview Questions: You walk into your patients room and they are unconscious. What would you do? What are the possible causes ? What orders would you expect ?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: They will be very nice in interviews because if you take the offer, you go to hell. After you start to work for their research department, especially neurology research, you will want to change jobs as soon as you can.
Interview Questions: When can you start work

title: Research Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very laid back, only one round of interviews with project manager and the principle investigators. The a questions were causal and they used the  STAR format.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Hearing Aide Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Dearborn, MI) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was really professional. They inquired about my experience.  It was a really comfortable interview process. Nice ebb and flow  between the interviewers and myself . They also inquired about my current position and why I was leaving it.
Interview Questions: Why I was leaving my current position

title: Optometric Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was easy answered a few questions.  I have a second interview at the job site.  Hopefully I'll get the job.  The commute isn't bad at all. The hours for the position great for a student
Interview Questions: Why are you switching careers?

title: Senior Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward process that was handled efficiently. However, the salary range was not addressed at the beginning, leading to a mismatch in expectations when it came to the offer. The HR Department doing the negotiations didn’t have a real sense of what mattered in evaluating candidate experience.
Interview Questions: Strong array of questions and interviewers.

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: First interviewed with Exec Recruiter.  A week later I was contacted by an HR admin who was coordinating an interview with the Dev Dept.  I provided availability then after a week of no response and an ignored email message requesting an update, I finally received the schedule for the interview.  Interview was with direct reports for the open position, I ever spoke with the actual hiring manager but about 2 weeks later, I received an email from a 3rd HR staff member notifying me that I was not considered to move forward.
Interview Questions: Asked about my experience fundraising, collaboration, etc.

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: disorganized. i felt like they were grabbing people out of the hallway to interview me.  the chai was asking behavioral interview type questions as if i was a resident i have been in practice almost 15 years
Interview Questions: tell me about a time a patient encounter went badly

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: They were nice people. Enjoyed their jobs and what they did. Asked fair questions and wanted to know more about you personally. Wanted to make sure you cared about the people you are working with and on.
Interview Questions: How proficient are you in technology?

title: Clinic Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Novi, MI) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone interview that took no more than 10 minutes. My second phone interview was virtual but ended up being a phone call due to technical issues. Questions were basic interview questions that are used often in interviews.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone screen with the clinical nutrition supervisor where they described the job details, and then a scheduled zoom interview with 2 team dietitians. The phone screen lasted 45 minutes because I asked a lot of questions, and the zoom interview lasted about 1 hour with behavioral and clinical questions.
Interview Questions:
Describe the dietitian's role in a multidisciplinary team.
What would you assess in a stroke patient, cancer patient, dialysis patient?
Tell us about a time you showed initiative.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was very slow initially because I didn’t get a call back until 2 months after I applied. The 1st interview was with 2 supervisors via Skype. It consisted of common behavioral questions that they read from a list. Then a few weeks later I was contacted by the manager of the department where I had another virtual interview. I was asked only a few questions and basically got more in-depth information about the position. Two weeks later I got a call from HR with the offer.
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflict with a coworker?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not as seamless as I thought it would be. It was all virtual to which I didn’t  even get a chance to Interview. I needed to have Zoom for business and I was unable to connect upon multiple attempts and computer resets.
Interview Questions: I didn’t get a chance to be interviewed.

title: Point of Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Conversational and straightforward. There were a series of behavioral questions and how you handle yourself in certain situations. It’s also important to talk about how you’re a team player and like working with a variety of people. You show respect to everyone, etc.
Interview Questions: How do you keep yourself organized when you have multiple projects going at the same time?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process with 3-4 leaders. Come prepared to answer questions about your experience and prepared to ask questions about the position. The interview was not very hard at all as long as you interview well getting a position of this sort is not difficult
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
Are you familiar with Microsoft Office? 
Are you able to handle difficult situations? 
Give me examples where you have had several projects how do you handle getting all your work done?

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick and easy over the phone process, the interviewer seemed a little uneasy or nervous during the interview but he asked good questions, the interview was set up through a contractor techsystems.
Interview Questions: How do you set dhcp and static IP

title: Credentialing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: I met with all members of the department for my interview via zoom meeting as a COVID19 precaution.  Each member asked a series of behavioral type questions.  The interview lasted about an hour and was a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: If you came upon a mistake that your coworker made, how would you handle addressing the mistake?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Spoke with other team members to get a feel for fit on team.  Able to ask questions and get a glimpse of the floor that you would be working on
Interview Questions: Are you able to multitask while keeping your composure

title: Insurance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Dearborn, MI) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I was greeted by the interviews, which was the supervisor, manager, and one office staff. Because they saw that I had the qualification to do the job and I was willing to be flexible, I think we connected very well.
I think the interview went well. I was told all about the job and what was expected of me.
Interview Questions: One of the things that was asked, "was I ok with coming in early and how good of a team player I was.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Interview went good, the interviewer gave me her number and told me to call back, I called the HR person as well, she told me to wait until Monday (interiew was on Friday) waited until Monday, nothing happened and was told to call on g Thursday, still nothing and was given an excuse, finally called today just for them to say that they found someone else.

You guys wasted my time trying to find jobs. The reason they did this was because they saw me apply to plenty of jobs at their hospital.
Interview Questions: Whu did you pick this job

title: Health Screener Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Jackson, MI) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Real easy process, I applied on their website and received a phone call a week or two later, I had a phone interview and then we set up an in person interview.  I got an offer a couple days later.  Had to pass drug test and background check.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at HFHS?

title: Administrative Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and if you are lucky , you go to the second round of interview. It was a call with six fellows asking you bunch of questions, some of them were really difficult and some were ok.
Interview Questions: If you were a tool in a tool box, what instrument you will pick and why?

title: Floater Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a very relaxed interview. Was asked questions about myself, basically like a two minute elevator pitch. Was asked some situational questions, I felt pretty confident leaving the interview.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview with three senior individuals. Forty five minutes to one hour long. Process questions and behavioral questions.  The interview was perfect if you prepare yourself. Very personable and energetic persona throughout the interviewing process.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about you (your profession) that is not on your resume?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (New York, NY) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: While I understand multi-tasking during WFH during the pandemic, I did not think it was appropriate for the HR recruiter to do their dishes while interviewing a candidate. Yes. Unfortunately, I could hear the running water then the  dishwasher. The interviewer also came across as unprepared to answer my questions. Finally, I was ghosted. It was so unprofessional, I was glad I don't work there. I certainly thought they could do better. People don't realize that they are the face of the brand and bad behavior erodes brand equity forever.
Interview Questions: describe your experience in the function you are interviewing for, example: finance or marketing or quality

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Great overall you should try it hard workers will succeed and have a great time and meet many great new People! People are nice and they’re is so much to learn interview process very good very great
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Certified Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and straight forward.  They asked about my skills. And customer service. I was shown around and told they'll call me. I don't know if i got it. They haven't called yet
Interview Questions: Based on my resume

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick, hiring process was as well. You do about a month of training to get to know the system and their values. Training with a nurse to do all your certifications and then more training on the floor.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Communications and Community Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Jackson, MI) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Absolute worst interview experience I've ever had. The man interviewing me wasn't listening, asked me to repeat full questions multiple times because he wasn't taking notes. Generally very awkward and generic questions.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Clinton Township, MI) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Meeting with the manager and lead at the office. 
Asking questions regarding to questions I had to answer prior to the interview at the online application. Time spent about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Working under pressure, strength, working with difficult patients

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: First was a phone screen with two of the biostatistician, received onsite interview few days after. During the onsite, I talked with 12 people, each around 30 minutes, they talked about what their doing and ask what you've done about your projects, some asked about the results and why. Very conversational, not too technical, they asked about details of your project and how you project may relate to the project they've done in HFHS. Also some asked about how to deal with communications with clinicians. Prepare more questions to ask to fill up the time. Had a 2 hour lunch break with two of the junior biostatistician, very helpful, can ask about questions outside of work, which were also interviewers. It was a great experience, everyone in the team are nice!
Interview Questions: describe your project

title: Engineering Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview followed by in-person interview. The phone interview was 1 on 1, answering the more common in-person interview questions: strengths and weaknesses, excel experience, etc. In-person was a panel made up of the team members.
Interview Questions: Asked to explain how I would go about solving a facility space problem

title: Biomedical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was great. Found out within one week & a half that I did not recieve job. First was phone, then in person manager meeting, then meeting with super visor & manager. After final meeting found out I did not get job the next day. Which I really respected, & appreciated. This was a dialysis biomedical technician position which payed significantly below market value while also limiting the opportunity to become biomed II, or biomed III one day  as this role allowed for no chance of advancement. If you have a biomed degree I suggest you look else where. If you have a biomed degree & 1 year or more experience I strongly suggest you look else where. If you have a degree & two years or more experience I would say dont even waste your time. You would be better suited as a traditonal clinical engineer biomed  with the pay to match. Also was just one other tech to be responsible for all the machines at the location I interviewed for. If you are out of a job & just looking to pay some bills this would be perfect to bide your time while you found a better job. Luckily for me my dad always told me to save my money which I did & I have 5 years living expenses saved so I can afford to wait for the perfect role. Good luck all my biomeds.
Interview Questions: Am I willing to mop floors where supplies are stored

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Like a conversation, no structure, just asked a couple of questions and then HR said you're hired with no amount to offer and then training started downtown Detroit. Then EPIC training and TB skin test and immunization records.
Interview Questions: There is a PCA that is a bully, how will you handle it

title: PSA II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Really easy question  process. It was fast, got through it in about 20 minutes. Went on a walk through and met a few employees who had only great things to say. A cake walk if ever
Interview Questions: What was your last position

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Got a email and call from HR to schedule an interview fro Henry Ford Health System. Interview went well on scheduled time.  There  was two different round of interview. One with team manager and one with HR.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Executive Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Intense interview with 3 people. Went around the table asking predetermined questions. Interviewers were kind and friendly. Interview was very formal. Had to take 4 hours of personality testing and a 1 hour phone interview with a psychologist.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Henry Ford?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview went extremely well and easy, it felt more like a conversation versus an interview. I spoke with 3 nurse managers. I got called for my interview a week after applying and got an offer the next day after applying. I love the health system so I was excited.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself? conflict resolution?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were very professional and eager to tell me about the health system. They were clearly proud of what the system had accomplished and to be a part of it. They were very receptive and thorough when answering my questions. This was my first interview after completing physical therapy school and the interviewers created a positive, low pressure setting for the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time in which you were in conflict with a patient and how did you resolve this conflict?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online as an employee referral from a VP.  No phone screen with recruiter, straight to phone interviews with 2 of the hiring executives.  Then asked to come for onsite which required  air travel.  All arrangements handled by executive assistant and external travel agency. Rental car was not direct billed, so I was asked to submit my receipt and expense report, which I did promptly. No reimbursement was issued even after polite follow up.  Onsite felt more like they were selling me on the position, which was fine, but some of the questions didn't provide much insight into my skills or value to the role. (Ex: "How do you like to manage projects?" When I asked for more specificity, the question was changed to, "Which project management program do you like to use?"  I wasn't being interviewed for a PM position.  Follow up took 3 weeks to receive. HFHS has such a great reputation and I was willing to move to join the team, but interview experience was disappointing and costly.
Interview Questions: What project management program do you like to use?

title: Interior Design Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Well organized and comfortable environment with a kind and well prepared interviewer. I enjoyed my time in the interview and felt comfortable with the other people around me! I was impressed and pleased
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself being an asset to our team?

title: senior counsultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Troy, MI) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: First round of interviews was with directors and manager followed by an offer and background screening. Easy process, and was very straight forward. One of the easiest interview and onboarding processes I have had.
Interview Questions: What are the steps in PDCA.

title: Laboratory Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: First, I was shown around the laboratory. Then, I  had a  panel interview. Prepare to answer questions with positive, but gainful for employment answers.  They were very thorough and wanted to make sure they pick someone with great customer service skills and knowledge of working within a laboratory.
Interview Questions: How will you handle an employee that you just can’t get along with?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Dearborn, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to come in for an initial interview at a satellite HF clinic located in Dearborn, MI. I met with the other APPs in the team. We reviewed my resume and past experiences together.
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in this specialty?

title: Social Worker I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position online. Received a call 6 weeks later asking if I was interested in coming in for an interview.  Met with the program manager and one other staff person.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a client

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview then an in person interview, They did not ask any technical questions. They do a nicotine and drug test. Was definitely not somewhere I wanted to work.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had conflicts in the work place?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Very nice folks, nice and laid back process. Ask basic questions about yourself and your interest for the job. Past experience is helpful to make you a better applicant. Make sure to bring a copy of your resume
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work here

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview + In-person Skill Based questions and Behavioral questions asked. Interviewers were calm. They had a sheet with questions, and one of them was taking notes. Even though I was not selected for the position, I had a overall positive experience.
Interview Questions: Short Term and Long Term Goals

title: Intake Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Ferndale, MI) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was called by a staff member and scheduled for an interview the next day. Interview took place at the hospital with two staff members.  Standard interview questions - tell us about yourself and past experience, why are you interested in the job, etc.  There were a few STAR-type questions as well (e.g., "Tell me about a time you had a conflict at work and how did you resolve it" - that wasn't the exact question but there were similar questions.)
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with intake?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (West Bloomfield, MI) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was great. Very personal. I felt like they had a good idea about who I was at the end of the interview. After the interview they had me come back for a second interview to shadow a nurse in the department that I would be working for to see if I liked it and if they liked me. It was a really good experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty straightforward process where they asked to meet me in person and asked about my experiences and qualifications. It was a friendly exchange and they also went into depth what my job duties would be.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are best suited for this position?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the assistant manager and the clinical manager. They took turns asking me questions about the quality of my nursing care and my background. They asked me about my hobbies and what I did to relax and de-stress.
Interview Questions: one of the questions that they asked was related to my home care experience. and that they wanted to know, how does experiences in home care could translate to inpatient care.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Th interview was very intense, but purposefully so. I feel that they were looking for strong candidates and did my best in answering all of the questions asked. I was asked questions 1 on 1 with a woman who worked in the department I was applying for.
Interview Questions: Previous experience with pediatric population

title: Surgical Reprocessng Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Clinton Township, MI) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was given a short written quiz on basic math and identifying common surgical instruments. One of the interviewers had less experience and job knowledge than myself and had difficulty reading the questions.
Interview Questions: The interviewers were having difficulty reading basic questions supplied to them by Human Resources and had to re-read the questions several times to ensure that it was correct. Human Resources personnel was not present, just a supervisor and one employee with one year of experience. They seemed to be focusing on attendance.

title: Optical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Troy, MI) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, family oriented, positive energy form the time you walk in the door, awesome attention to details, very promoted with questions, gave a tour after the interview awesome perks with working with Henry ford
Interview Questions: What brings you to our company

title: Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Panel style interview with typical interview questions. Took about three weeks to hear back from them. Hard to get in touch with HR.. they do not return phone calls often
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a problem that you couldn’t solve and what was the outcome.

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about most of the day, I was allowed to shadow in the unit I was applying for. The entire staff was kind and helpful and even took the time to show me equipment I had never seen or used before. Some of the staff then interviewed me and afterward the unit manager did as well. THE ENTIRE STAFF (everyone!! I mean it) was SO KIND.
Interview Questions: They used the interview tool to ask me questions about difficult proior experiences Id had, times when I wish I had done better, etc. Standard interview question.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by employee panel from the Department. Found later that those on the panel are not the most senior, experienced, or appropriate employees. More of the "favorites" of the manager.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you disagreed with your supervisor, and how did you handle it?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Intimidating phone interview  to me. Wish any one the very best and Godspeed. Great institution. Intimidating phone interview  to me. Wish any one the very best and Godspeed. Great institution.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Principal Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very informal. It was not a situational or behavioral based interview. 3-4 questions was all that I was asked. The interview very short. I got to meet with five different members of the team all at different seniority and professional levels. However, the team seemed very limited on the time that they could hold the interview. It was scheduled for 30 minutes, and at 22 minutes in the staff was looking at their watches as if they had another meeting scheduled right afterwards.
Interview Questions: I was asked about projects that I worked on in my previous roles.

title: Mid Level Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR for a screening interview and then met with several members of the department.  I had individual interviews with severals of the current providers and then lunch with the team.
Interview Questions: Questions about my previous positions and current interests

title: Executive Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Jackson, MI)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for a position in the Jackson Allegiance location. I received communication within 1 week of applying and had an initial interview scheduled the following week. I was interviewed by 3 other executive assistants. They had been there varying amounts of time and had a set list of questions to ask. They were all very nice and the interview seemed to go well. They said the next step would be to have a direct interview with the person I would be working directly with if I made it through the first round. It's been 3 months and I never had any further communication after that. Even just to say that I hadn't made it to the next round.
Interview Questions: Name a recent time you made a mistake and what did you do to correct it

title: Call Center Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews in 1 day.  Met with upper management then a supervisor afterwards.  After the 2nd interview with Supervisor she told me up front she was going to recommend a job offer. Typical interview.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral format with time for questions at the end. The process too about an hour and a half. Three business days for offer. Very minimal negation of the offer.
Interview Questions: Why Henry Ford? How well do you do with ambiguity?

title: HRIS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: 3 months telephone and then face to face with the Hiring Manager and the team including Director. Slow process though and poor communication on the part of follow -up post interview for the feedback.
Interview Questions: Are you a team player or independent?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Two round of phone talk followed by a one day on site. One that day, I talked with about 10 people. It's pretty intense, but they are very friendly. In general, it's a good experience.
Interview Questions: What statistical software do I prefer

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line.  Received e-mail to schedule phone interview 2 days later.  Had very good phone interview and was told my resume would be forwarded to the hiring manager who would get in touch with me when he returned from vacation.  I received call from hiring manager 2 weeks later and scheduled face-to-face.  I was interviewed by hiring mgr and another mgr from a different department.  Mgr. began the interview by telling me that he felt I would be bored with the job (from this I determined that I would not get the position).  He stated that he was 'entrenched' in his position and was not planning on moving out.  He explained that the vacancy was due to another employee leaving after becoming frustrated that there was no promotional opportunities within the department.  He again stated that I would be bored with the position, as it was only a portion of the job I was doing with my current employer.  He described his family situation to me and stated that he was not looking to move to another department.
Interview Questions: If you took out a full-page ad in the New York Times that described you in three words, what would those words be?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a call to come in for a panel interview about 2 weeks later. The panel interview asked mostly behavioral and situational questions and lasted about 30 minutes. Received call with job offer about 2 weeks later after they went through the reference checking process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and behavioral/situational questions.

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call two weeks later. I received a job offer from HR a day after my interview and from there I was sent emails with paperwork to set up my physical and for other requirements. The interview was pretty laid back. I interview with the nurse manager on the floor. She was very down to earth and made me feel comfortable. The interview questions were the typical "Can you recall a time this happened and how you dealt with it." The interview lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Account Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR. Strange 2 hour interview. One with manager for an hour. Second one with 2 other people in the department. Not really asked any professional questions, Henry Ford OptimEyes.  Second interview they mostly talked about themselves and to each other.
Interview Questions: What did I get out of College experience?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions:
Initial phone interview asked for a brief description of what courses I was taking and what projects I'd been working on.

In person interview was about 2 weeks later. The interview is an entire day and they shuffle you in and out of 30 minute interviews with 2-3 people each. So by the end of the day you've met at least 14 different people. Each interview generally started with employees describing their position and what they do. Some went into painful detail describing the structure of the department. Eventually they'd ask for a basic description of a project I'd worked on, data cleaning, stats methods. Very high level and non-technical. It was very conversational and relaxed.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite and least favorite thing about data analysis

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: interview process was awkward.  I wasn't there for long.  She asked a few questions and then assumed I would take the position and called my supervisor with dates I could start.  so needless to say my supervisor and I were both shocked.
Interview Questions: how I can make the workplace better.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was an online application process followed by a brief telephone interview by the HR representative. The HR rep forwarded application to the department where I participated in a two panel discussion with the administration team. That was followed by an interview with the director the applicate would work with.
Interview Questions: Given my background why did I coose to apply for the position?

title: Histotechnologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and not overwhelming. I went in with business casual attire. Very friendly however they were serious about getting to know me and how well of a fit I would be to the company. They were interested in my experience and knowledge of overall laboratory history.
Interview Questions: What area in the lab do you feel most comfortable with and which areas do you feel you need improvement with.

title: Remote Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Submitted app online, got a email a couple days later to do a voice interview via app. The app ask a series of questions, given a few minutes to respond. Very easy process.
Interview Questions: Two vacation packages were presented, Which package would you recommend.

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online. A couple days later I was contacted for an interview. Two days after the interview I was contacted by the nurse manager saying she had reached out to HR to offer me the position. Following that email HR contacted me and spoke with me on the phone for an hour about the offer.
Interview Questions: mostly questions having to do with how much you care for others. no critical thinking or skills questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Macomb, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Call from HR within 1 week of application process. Hiring manager called 3 days later and scheduled an interview for the position. Completed interview and it was a considerable amount of time (1 month)before I was called with an offer for the job I applied to. Overall it was a good process and the company is great :)
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you had to handle employee conflict in the workplace and what did u do to solve it?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I really enjoyed my interview. Basically they wanted to get a feel for my personality and if I would be a good fit for the team. Very easy going and not intimidating at all
Interview Questions: Why do we want to hire you?

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Job was posted on the Health system's career page, I applied for the position online. I received a  call to set up an interview about two weeks after applying. I went to the interview which went well and I accepted the position contingent on if my manager gave me a good referral.
Interview Questions: How long do you plan to be working in this position?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very brief interview; lasted about 10 minutes. I had two recruiters conducting my interview. Was asked the basic questions such as greatest weakness, strength, why I applied to the organization, what interested me about the department, and what I wanted my future to look like. Fairly short interview to hire process.
Interview Questions: Q: Why did you decide to apply to Henry Ford Health System?

title: Surgical Reprocessing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very well! The man I interviewed with gave me a lot of information about the position, hospital and other employees. We both asked each other plenty of questions. He made me well informed what the position requirements are. It was a professional interview yet we shared some great laughs! Halfway through the interview I felt comfortable already. Great interview experience!
Interview Questions: Explain a problem you encountered at your current or former job, how did solve the problem?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Jackson, MI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with supervisor and director, then peer interview. I had a total of 3 interviews for RN job and the HR department is extremely slow and annoying. The peer interviews were not difficult they ask the standard questions and see how good a fit you will be.
Interview Questions: How did you manage conflict on the job?

title: Pharmacologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy interview. Just applied online and met them. Answered some questions and got it.  Management reached out to me within a week and hired me. Was awesome
Interview Questions: Why Henry Ford?

title: Optometist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (West Bloomfield, MI) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was To the point, standard questions. Work 4 ten hours days with OMDs. Good benefits and pay. Interviewed at West Bloomfield Optimus location. Not very difficult.  Asked your salary expectations.
Interview Questions: Expected salary

title: Contact Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Had an initial phone interview/screening that was favorable. After that I was scheduled for a face to face interview.

This was a negative experience for a few reasons:

1. I was not seen until 30 minutes after the scheduled interview time; although punctuality was stressed beforehand and I arrived 15 minutes early. 

2. The interview was easy, with typical questions... but the interviewer was rude. 

3. Before the interview we were told via email to park in their garage. However, they refused to validate any of the interview candidates' parking upon the completion of the interview. So what was the point of telling us to park there? I could have parked for free on the street. (This was especially frustrating because I spent 45 minutes waiting for the interview, and I was charged for that time.)

I decided not to continue with the interview process because it wasn't a good fit for me.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for HFHS?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: It is hard and I have been trying everywhere for six months I get did encourage some time,especially when I see that it more a compatibility reason then skills,that a problem but I live with it my reason had not left me and I still love why I want to to this
Interview Questions: what is your real reason for working hear and how well do you work with others

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview. We sat on-site in the office, and the Chief Innovation Officer, Innovation Institute Director, and Assistant to the CIO conducted a panel interview. The interview was formal, but the panel was warm and encouraging. After the interview concluded, they called back after one month to let me know I had been selected for the position. I do not know if other candidates interviewed for the same position, and did not inquire on this subject.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

What are the greatest obstacles to Innovation in Detroit?

title: Cardiac Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Wyandotte, MI) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very sketchy.  Met with one person who said was from personnel but knew little about the job. Would like to have met with or at least spoken to person in that position
Interview Questions: What other jobs would you apply for

title: Patient Care Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really efficient and seamless. It's a one to one after a phone call and then a drug test. The one to one consists of bringing your resume and asking simple questions.
Interview Questions: Why would we ask you that question?

title: Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Troy, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. Straight forward and standard questions were asked. It was very laid back and relaxed. More like a panel interview was done as opposed to one on one
Interview Questions: Are your hours flexible

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Slow; unprofessional.  Interview panels didn't have prepared questions.  Failed to follow-up as promised (no communication).  Any doubts on whether it was a place to work were confirmed by lack of follow through.  They haven't figured out that their "brand" is how they treat candidates.

The online application contained "screening questions" that should be interview questions.  There were several questions that required text responses.
Interview Questions: Why interested in Henry Ford?

title: Staff MICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was moderately tough.  The managers and educators were present and allowed to ask questions.  They were all on time, professional, personable, and the length of the interview was appropriate (approx. 30 - 45 minutes).  I felt at ease overall and was told on the spot that I would be hired pending on routine HR back ground checks, nicotine check, etc.
Interview Questions: How would I handle difficult co-workers?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a good feeling just walking onto the unit. The interview was your typical questions but in a conversational way. There were three individuals plus myself. They were really interested in my experiences. It took a month for the application to be reviewed before being called for an interview.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about customer service

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Macomb, MI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with nurse supervisor along with a nurse that was working the day of my interview. All three of us sat in the office and I was asked a few questions such as why I wanted the job. Other than some structural questions we talked about my life and my future plans.
Interview Questions: How I would be a good asset to their staff?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Dearborn, MI) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Optimeyes Customer service rep. 1st interview consisted of general questions, very easy laid back. Immediately had 2nd interview afterwards. Then called for a 3rd then I was offered the position
Interview Questions: Asked about prior work experience and how you deal with rude customers

title: PTA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I scheduled a phone interview. The individual called on time and asked a few questions concerning the information I presented online and asked more questions. He stated at the end of the interview he would share the information with the director of the facility and they would get back with me in a few days. I have not heard from them since and it has been 1 week.
Interview Questions: What career goals do I have?

title: Bioresources Technician/Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I received an email stating that this company wanted a phone interview for a position. It did not state which position it was for (I applied for several). As directed, I logged into the system in order to check. Both positions indicated "under review by HR" as a status.

 I set aside time for the phone interview, which I prepared for. I received the call on time, although the person calling was not the person I was supposed to be interviewing with. She began telling me about the position, which was one of the positions I had applied for, but the job turned out to be far below my capabilities and pay grade (basically cleaning animal rooms). The description was not what I applied for, since I had chosen research positions. When asked if it was something I was interested in, I politely informed her that I was not interested in that position based on the terms she described, but that I had over 7 years of research experience, a bachelor's degree, and was a certified technician. I told her that I applied for research positions and wanted to know the status of those applications. She was polite and so I was polite in return..up until now! 

To this inquiry she responded (in a newly cool tone of voice), "No, you need a masters degree to be doing things like that. And the next time you apply for a position with us, you need to actually be reading the job descriptions so that this doesn't happen again." 

WHAT?? 

She insinuated that I had just wasted her time by applying for jobs I wasn't actually going to be interested in. I replied that I had in fact applied for the jobs which listed my qualifications, which was actual research. She replied, "Well if they WERE interested in you, they would have called you." That was the end of the conversation.

I was taken aback at the blatant rudeness. They called a person with a B.S. in Biology, several years of research experience and 3 technician certifications and offer them a job mopping floors for less than half of what they are actually worth in the marketplace. Then when they aren't interested, proceed to insult their intelligence and give them a lecture? That is NOT ok.

Henry Ford wasted my time by:

A-Not taking the time to read my resume, and insulting me when they discovered I was overqualified for their position and wasn't interested.  

OR 

B-Reading my resume, and insulting me by disregarding my education, experience and certifications, then lecturing ME about wasting their time. 

I will not be applying for any positions at Henry Ford in the future, ever. I DO NOT want to work for a company that treats people this way. Highly unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Would you be interested in a position like this?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Jackson, MI) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by panel/group interview, then 1:1 mgr interview. The entire process took kind of a long time. I feel things get bottle-necked in the HR dept. It was a month after I applied online that I finally got called for interview.
Interview Questions: What is one of the most difficult conflicts you had with someone and how did you handle it?

title: Or Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Wyandotte, MI) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with three individuals, the person who would be my direct boss, her supervisor and a person who worked with in the department. Three person panel. Each person asked me individual questions of there own. They each wanted to talk about different experiences I had and how I thought I qualified for they position.  They asked why did I want this position.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult time at your job and how you handled it.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Plymouth, MI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very thorough. The manager asked many questions to get an idea of my skills. I received a tour of the facility and was able to ask as many questions as possible.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing by two lead security staff members. Very professional and polite. Asked about qualifications and experience. The basic interview questions you get for any job so not hard to prepare answers before hand or struggle to answer well.
Interview Questions: What past experience challenged you and how did you lean from it

title: Registered Polysomnographic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was in February of 2015.The interview panel (consisting of two people) was diverse, in that the sleep technicians are male and female of two different ethnicities that interviewed me. This was a good choice that made me feel less uncomfortable than I normally would.They asked me enough questions and received enough answers that lasted for 30 minutes.  The interviewers also showed me around the sleep clinic.
Interview Questions: What do you like about your current job? What don't you like about your current job? What are your assets? Have you ever had a difficult patient?

title: Hematology/Oncology MA Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well. I had a group interview. Receiving the job offer wasn't a long process but, I wish I would of known about all this test you had to pass to work there!!!
Interview Questions: What can you bring to Henry Ford Health System?

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Simply put, I was a referal by my materials manager.  I filled out the application and my background check information.  Turned it in.  Received a call within 2 weeks to come in and discuss the job.
Interview Questions: Background check questions.  More often than not, the information does not accurately define the candidate nor does it speak to that candidates ability to perform the job.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process wasn't bad at the all. They asked simple questions as far as what type of person you are, if you are a people person, and of you are flexible.  The atmosphere is extremely nice also. I would choose wear bloomfield any day as my location.  The downtown location has a odd smell. People tend to say the west Bloomfield location is snooty but they are actually very friendly.
Interview Questions: How well do you work with others?

title: ER Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received phone screening three weeks after applying. Standard questions about education and previous experience, was told I would later receive another call from the hiring manager regarding the interview. Interviewed two weeks after the phone interview.
Interview Questions: What have you contributed to make a strong team? What would your previous employer say if we called?

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Bingham Farms, MI) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty laid back.  Submitted application through web site and was called a few months later to my surprise.  Pharmacy director was very up fronts and straight forward with his goals and needs.
Interview Questions: What made me leave Meijer pharmacy

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen by R clerk lasted about 15 minutes.  The next step was a telephone interview by the hiring manager for 30 minutes.  From time of application to receiving a rejection letter took 2 months.  Very slow process, and little communication other than the two brief phone calls.  ring manager did not respond to follow-up questions.
Interview Questions: Typical questions like what was your favorite project, largest project, what do you know about agile, etc.

title: Medical Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Honestly, I applied to similar positions at various locations within the health system, I really can't tell you how long that initial process took, but my best guess would be 3 weeks before, I received a invite for an interview. My interview was straightforward and it was comprised of two Registered Nurses, who were very polite and helped me feel at ease. They talked about the position and what it entailed and asked me questions about my education and experience. I don't think it was a difficult interview at all, in fact, afterwards, I was a little concerned as to if I had given off a vibe of being too comfortable.  After the interview, it was explain to me that they had other candidates to interview (which is standard interview mumble jumble) and they would let me know in a week or so. A week or so went by and nothing, just as I had given up hope, my phone rings and I am offered the job!!!!
Interview Questions: No hard questions if you're qualified for the position you're seeking; just be yourself.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call to set up an interview just one day after I applied online. The interview process went well. The questions were read directly off a sheet which I believe is probably just a corporate policy, but it felt a little impersonal. I brought a portfolio with me that had letters of recommendation, copies of my resume, proof of volunteer work, etc. The only document they asked me for was a list of references, but at least I appeared prepared! I was asked a lot of "have you ever experienced a time when... and what did you do?" questions (you noticed another nurse was impaired, you made a mistake, you had a difficult and needy patient, etc).  A recruiter called me the next day to offer me the position! I am very pleased with how quickly the process occurred.
Interview Questions: The very first question was, "Name three reasons why you chose to apply for a job at this hospital". Maybe it was because it was the first question, but it threw me off to try to genuinely answer that question without sounding insincere or tacky.

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview that was followed by an on-site panel interview. Telephone interview was with the current Fellows at Henry Ford. The on-site interview was conducted over 2 days. There was networking, individual interviews, and it concluded with a panel interview. Process was rigorous, yet it was never uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position at Henry Ford Health System?

title: Interventional Radiology Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Wyandotte, MI) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy panel of employees with a list of the usual weird questions.  typical interview process. took a long time to call back with offer.  management was nice and most employees were happy there.
Interview Questions: Why are you good for this job

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: The process of the interview and communication was well handled...However, after having a great in person interview, I saw a lot of unprofessionalism based on communication and really being hospitable to the potential employee.  Salary was very low for someone with a Masters as well.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Home Heath Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position and with a couple months I received a call for an interview.  The interview Process was a typical interview. The manager asked questions  pertaining to the jobs
Interview Questions: Why do you like you are the perfect candidate for this position

title: Internal Medicine Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: standard, procedure submitted a CV, was contacted by physician recruiter.  Answered question regarding  what type of practice i would like to participate in and what was available.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Firstly worked as a volunteers for 3 month, then hired as a full-time employee. Can I say I experienced a 3-month interview...? When hired as a volunteer, since it was non-payment, the interview was just like knowing if you can do what they want. My experience maybe quite different from others, because I was working for a department instead of the whole hospital IT.
Interview Questions: What kind of programming languages do you know?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Jackson, MI) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: After applying online I first had a Phone interview. After the phone interview I then interviewed with HR in person a few days later. Once I passed the HR stage, I then interviewed with department manager and a separate peer interview.
Interview Questions: Tell about a time you made a mistake and how did you handle it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: The process was slow, but everyone was wonderful every step of the way. I originally had a phone interview, and then was sent to interview with the hiring manager. Everyone was kind and courteous and were willing to help along the way.
Interview Questions: Most questions were pretty cut and dry normal interview questions, just prepare yourself for these and educate yourself on the company.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview
Interview Questions: Straight forward, nothing unusual

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 7 physical therapists that worked at the location, there were a total of 3 candidates present for the interview. We went down the row answering questions from each interviewer
Interview Questions: Why was healthcare important to me?

title: Financial Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy. It was a panel of three, but no one seemed to have had any questions for me. I'm still not sure what that was about, but it seemed like it would have been a great place to work.
Interview Questions: Not a one. There were two employes who were already in the position. The manager gave them the floor to ask me questions and they had not a one. The panel was very nice though.

title: Materials Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
