Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds od interviews. Took 3 months to complete
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Referring Physician Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I got called in 1/2014 for an interview for this position. There were three people who interviewed me. The questions were basic/typical interview questions. The supervisor then asked the other ladies to leave and we did a one on one. Later, I learned the reason for the other employees to participate in the interview is to get a feel for the person being interviewed; to see if they are a good fit and will fit in with other employees for the position and the environment.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Southfield, MI) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received an email a month and a half later to come in for a face to face interview.  Interview went well.  Interviewer read from a list of prepared questions.  Did not offer what the next step was or a business card.  Appears they were going through different levels of resumes.
Interview Questions: Question that was asked:  Give a time where you made a mistake and it effected the company

title: Optometric Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Sterling Heights, MI) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very through, met with several managers for the position, some of the managers where not that friendly. They did make sure that I knew what the job entailed and what the benefits package was. I was accepted for the position and met with HR and received an offer letter.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest accomplishment?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was well
Interview Questions: What is a risk you have taken and failed?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: The hiring pocess requires a detailed written application about your work skills and job experiences
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Mental Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Not hard at all. Came in sat down. Answered some questions. Asked some questions. Took a tour of the facility. Went over some paperwork. Met some potential co-workers.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years down the road?

title: Human Resources Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health
Interview Descriptions: Henry Ford Health System uses the Peer Interview Panel approach. Thus, my interview was with 5 employees and really focused around Behavioral Based Interviews.  The questions were very challenging and the situation was very intimidating.  That said, it was a good way to get a feel for the people I would be working with and for them to see if I would be a good fit as well
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you were responsible for a major project that failed.  What did you do?

title: Patient Advocate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: As an Internal employee I was offered an Interview over the phone to accommodate my current work position, two days later I was asked to come in for an In-person Interview at that time I was introduced to staff and shown the working stations. The following week I was contacted via e-mail with the job offer once I accepted the offer I received a start date which followed my two week notice for my current position, and everything else was done as a lateral move.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RPSGT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was misleading. Promised career growth, promised they were looking for educated employees to help department to grow and better serve patients.  also said it was a diverse department that they prided themselves on excepting all walks of life.
Interview Questions: Not many actual relevant questions asked

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview went GREAT, I felt like i meet all the job requirements. I was interviewed by two managers. Still waiting to receive a call back. They told me in the interview I would know something by next week.
Interview Questions: There really weren't any difficult questions. I learned that if you just keep talking then it will be less questions that they ask.

title: CSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted bye HR. Then had my first interview with the head nurse.  They like the fact I would work holidays.  The I met with the surgical nursing team. They where more interested in my hobbies and social life.  The total interview time was 2 hrs.
Interview Questions: If you were on-call and you had been drinking. Would you come in and work? Or would you notify your supervisor you had been drinking.

title: Helpdesk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process was very smooth and in my opinion very logical. It started with a quick 20-30 minute phone interview with the department head that discussed background, skills, and general knowledge. There were a few technical questions that served as a baseline. After that call, the next day an in-person interview was scheduled for the beginning of the following week. This consisted of meeting with two of the team leads, and really seemed to be more of a way to gauge my personality. Approximately 2 weeks after that, I received and accepted the offer of employment.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions

title: Post Doctoral Fellow - Bone and Joint Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview
Interview Questions: Questions were ok.

title: Staff Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interviews with chairperson (was able to call back as often as necessary to get all questions answered); invitation for day-long interview with prospective colleagues and chairperson (included physicians of other departments that had significant interest in my area of expertise); dinner with key stakeholders; follow-up call with recruiter about benefits and compensation (written benefits documents provided for prior review); return visit with significant other to help in relocation
Interview Questions: How do you anticipate to contribute to the culture of patient safety and continuous quality improvement?

title: Corporate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for four different positions prior to being made an offer for the positon that I accepted.  I was very impressed with the organization and everyone I met.  I had heard that Henry Ford Health System was big on internal movement, so I knew I was competing with internal candidates.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in a career in Healthcare?

title: Cytotechnologist Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Mostly 1 on 1 but skills test was also taken
Interview Questions: Where do see yourself in 5 years

title: SICU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied on online for the SICU RN position, took about 2-3 weeks to receive a call back, then another week to get an interview, then started about a 2-3 weeks later, went through orientation, then unit orientation, took the CORE critical care class they offered, then began my unit orientation with my preceptor which lasted about 8-10 weeks.
Interview Questions: Do you have critical care experience?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: The company was very accommodating and friendly from the outset. There were two rounds of interviews, each with 5 people from the department. Everyone seemed very smart and driven. The workload seemed challenging but not overly heavy. I would advise other candidates to be personable and not overly stressed about the interview process, since it was quite relaxed.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Very nice interview.  They really highlight all the great points of the hospital, and how your career will likely pan out should you get a residency there.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult time you had in your life, and how you dealt with it.

title: Supply Chain Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Henry Ford Health (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2007
Interview Descriptions: Met with two different hiring managers, the directors of Supply Chain Systems and Purchasing. Explanation of the role and that opportunity would exist in the future to work with alternative departments if I was interested. Posed questions as to the last time anyone was in the role, what specifics more than the job description did the role include. Asked specific questions on whether I'd be working independently or in groups at all time.
Interview Questions: N/A
